wikitext.*:
'''When I'm Dead''' is a song by [[E.V. Gordon]]. It is published as the 27th song in ''[[Songs for the Philologists]]'' in [[1936]].

It is presented in three languages: [[Old English]], Scots, and [[Gothic]].

==In Old English==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
Þa ic beo dead.
no byrgaþ lic min,
at doð min ban
on blod-read win.

Sete fullne belg
æt heafd' and fet,
wel þæt mines lices
brosnung bett.
</poem>

==In Scots==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
Quhan deid me tais,
O biri nocht me,
bot sett ilk a bain 
in cleir clarré.

Sett ane bottel o bouse
at mi heid and mi foit,
and in rest and in ro
everma i moit.
</poem>

==In Gothic==
<poem style="font-style:italic; margin-left:20px;">
Gadauþna' ic þan,
ni allis filh mik,
ak daupiþs in wein
fagino ik.

Satei fairnana balg
and haubiþ mein —
ganisand auk baina
daupida, in wein.
</poem>

[[Category:Poems and songs in Songs for the Philologists]]
